edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Animation is a way of describing a set of images that can be used to animate an entity. Animations consist of regions of an image, the indices that should be played, and the time each should be shown. For example, suppose there is an image "glowball.png" with 5 frames. The "cells" will consist of the 5 frames (numbered 0 to 4) that can be shown. We can then set an animation such as (0,300)->(2,100)->(0,600)->(4,100) to indicate that the animation should show the 0th frame for 300 milliseconds, then the 2nd frame for 100 milliseconds, then the 0th frame for 600 milliseconds, then the 4th frame for 100 milliseconds.

    • Constructor Summary

      Animation(java.lang.String imgName, int sequenceCount, boolean repeat)
      Create an animation.
      Animation(java.lang.String imgName, int timePerFrame, boolean repeat, int... frameIndices)
      Create an animation where all of the frames are displayed for the same amount of time

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.lang.String imgName,
         int sequenceCount,
         boolean repeat)
        Create an animation. The animation can hold up to sequenceCount steps, but none will be initialized yet. You will need to use the "to" method to initialize the steps.
        Parameters:
        imgName - The animate-able image that should be used
        sequenceCount - The number of frames in the animation
        repeat - Either true or false, depending on whether the animation should repeat

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.lang.String imgName,
         int timePerFrame,
         boolean repeat,
         int... frameIndices)
        Create an animation where all of the frames are displayed for the same amount of time
        Parameters:
        imgName - The animate-able image that should be used
        timePerFrame - The time in milliseconds that each frame should be shown
        repeat - true or false, depending on whether the animation should repeat
        frameIndices - The indices of the image that should each be shown for timePerFrame milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • to

        public Animation to(int frame,
           long duration)
        Add another step to the animation
        Parameters:
        frame - The index within the image that should be displayed next
        duration - The time in milliseconds that this frame should be shown
        Returns:
        the Animation, so that we can chain calls to "to()"
